replies.message: We don't need one, because we have the right to get married and have our entitled rights, Helen.

1 - are you beaten for being straight? no? then you don't get one.
2 - are you killed in other countries for being straight? no? then you don't get one.
3 - are you abandoned by your family for being straight? no? then you don't get one.
4 - can you lose your job for being straight? no? then you don't get one.
5 - YOU DON"T GET ONE!!!
you don't get parades because you don't need pride. you won't be beaten or murdered for your sexual orientation. congratulations.
Where are these parade rules from?
what would you do for this said heterosexual parade? i can tell you one things for sure...it wouldnt be nearly as cool as an LGBT one. in fact, youd just look like an idiot im pretty sure.

Everyday because you can walk about being proud of who you are without getting comments thrown at you, beaten and abused for it. You walking down the street not being scared to be yourself is your parade.
Pull into a Walmart and park!  There's your parade, Helen.  Repeat daily if you like...
Helen, you will find that parade at your local Wal-Mart.  It is where you belong deary.
When it's illegal to be straight, you can have all the parades you want.
You don't much like everyone else said. And besides, I'd much rather go to a gay pride parade than to a "hetro pride" parade anyway.

Do I get to be an interior decorator? NO!
Do I get to go to cosmetology school? NO!
Do I get to drive VW Beetles? NO!
We don't need one because we don't need to overcome the shame and guilt of how we're living by constantly demanding everyone's approval.
Your attitude is every bit as hideous as your profile photo.

A straight-pride parade occurs every day when a straight couple walks down the street holding hands without worrying that someone is going to say something nasty to them (or worse), and in every office in America where a straight person can put up a framed photo of his or her family without fear of being ostracized or fired.
